application-versions.name: VMware vFabric SQLFire 1.0
application-versions.description: VMware vFabric™ SQLFire is an in-memory distributed SQL database. In the category of NewSQL databases, SQLFire delivers dynamic scalability and high performance for data-intensive modern applications.

owner-group.name: Default
owner-group.description: The Default vCloud Application Director group.

application.name: VMware vFabric SQLFire 1.0
application.description: VMware vFabric™ SQLFire is an in-memory distributed SQL database. In the category of NewSQL databases, SQLFire delivers dynamic scalability and high performance for data-intensive modern applications. This solution provides automated installation and configuration for vFabric SQLFire as a service.

ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/sh # vFabric ApplicationDirector Sample INSTALL script for vFabric GemFire
# This example uses the values posted below as defaults. To change any of these # values, add the Property Name as shown below as individual properties in your # service definition in the ApplicationDirector Catalog. The value specified after # the Property name is the Type to use for the property (i.e. String, Content, Array etc) # There are two types of properties for this script: Required and Optional. Both are # listed below. # # REQUIRED PROPERTIES: # These are the properties you must add in order for this sample script to work. The property # is added when you create your service definition in the ApplicationDirector Catalog. # Property Description: Property Value settable in blueprint [type]: # -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Location of global configuration data global_conf [Content] # value: https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # # OPTIONAL PROPERTIES: # Property Description: Property Name settable in blueprint: # -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # which java to use JAVA_HOME [String] # Installed Location of GemFire SQLFIRE_HOME [String] # GemFire version installed (default is 663) SQLFIRE_VERSION [String]
# import global configuration data from ApplicationDirector . $global_conf
set -e
echo "######################################################################" echo "#" echo "# Starting vFabric SQLfire Install Script For Application Director" echo "#" echo "######################################################################"
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/usr/bin:/bin export VMWARE_HOME=/opt/vmware export SQLFIRE_PACKAGE=vfabric-sqlfire export SQLFIRE_VERSION=${GEMFIRE_VERSION:="103"} export SQLFIRE_HOME=${SQLFIRE_HOME:="$VMWARE_HOME/$SQLFIRE_PACKAGE/vFabric_SQLFire_$SQLFIRE_VERSION"} export EULA_LOCATION=${EULA_LOCATION:="http://www.vmware.com/download/eula/vfabric_app-platform_eula.html"}
# Any of the following may be set as Properties in your service definition, and if enabled, may be overwritten # in your application blueprint. export JAVA_HOME=${JAVA_HOME:="/usr"}
# pre-set the license agreement for rpm if [ ! -d "/etc/vmware/vfabric" ]; then mkdir -p /etc/vmware/vfabric fi
echo "Setting Up vFabric Suite 5.1 RPM Repo" echo "I_ACCEPT_EULA_LOCATED_AT=${EULA_LOCATION}" >> /etc/vmware/vfabric/accept-vfabric5.1-eula.txt
if [ -f /etc/redhat-release ] ; then DistroBasedOn='RedHat' DIST=`cat /etc/redhat-release |sed s/\ release.*//` REV=`cat /etc/redhat-release | sed s/.*release\ // | sed s/\ .*// | awk -F. '{ print $1 }'` else echo "Installation only supported on RedHat; Exiting installation script" exit fi # setup repo if [ -f /bin/rpm ]; then if [ "$REV" == "5" ]; then echo "Installing vFabric Suite 5.1 EULA" #rpm -Uvh --force http://repo.vmware.com/pub/rhel5/vfabric/5.1/vfabric-5.1-repo-5.1-1.noarch.rpm wget http://repo.vmware.com/pub/rhel5/vfabric/5.1/vfabric-5.1-repo-5.1-1.noarch.rpm -O /tmp/vfabric-5.1-repo-5.1-1.noarch.rpm rpm -Uvh --force /tmp/vfabric-5.1-repo-5.1-1.noarch.rpm
elif [ "$REV" == "6" ]; then echo "Installing vFabric Suite 5.1 EULA" #rpm -Uvh --force http://repo.vmware.com/pub/rhel6/vfabric/5.1/vfabric-5.1-repo-5.1-1.noarch.rpm wget http://repo.vmware.com/pub/rhel6/vfabric/5.1/vfabric-5.1-repo-5.1-1.noarch.rpm -O /tmp/vfabric-5.1-repo-5.1-1.noarch.rpm rpm -Uvh --force /tmp/vfabric-5.1-repo-5.1-1.noarch.rpm else echo "Unsupported RedHat Version: ${REV}; Exiting installation" exit fi else echo "RPM utility not available; Exiting installation script" exit fi
if [ "$DistroBasedOn" == "RedHat" ]; then if [ "$DIST" == "CentOS" ]; then if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then echo 'SELinux is enabled. This may cause installation to fail.' fi fi if [ -f /usr/bin/yum ]; then echo "Installing ${SQLFIRE_PACKAGE}" yum -y -v install ${SQLFIRE_PACKAGE} else echo "ERROR! Unable to locate yum in ${PATH}; Exiting installer" exit fi fi
if [ -f ${SQLFIRE_HOME}/bin/sqlf ]; then echo "SUCCESS: ${SQLFIRE_PACKAGE} has been installed in ${SQLFIRE_HOME}" echo "Please see https://www.vmware.com/support/pubs/vfabric-sqlfire.html for more information" else echo "ERROR! SQLFire executable not found in ${SQLFIRE_HOME}; Exiting installer" exit fi
echo "######################################################################" echo "#" echo "# vFabric SQLfire Install Script Finished" echo "#" echo "######################################################################"
